brief_summary.textblock: The IPOD-B3 study aims to characterize the relationship between premorbid brain activity and postoperative delirium in patients undergoing major surgery. This is a expansion of the NeuroVISION Bolt-On study, NCT01980511.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Post-Operative days 1-4
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline functional connectivity at immediate postoperative period and association between delirium (CAM) and functional connectivity of the cingulate cortex

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: POD1-4
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the changes from preoperative to postoperative EEG associated with delirium and change in plasma IL-6
Identify biomarkers of delirium and neural damage through changes in circulating plasma proteins and molecules (through mass spectometry)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative MRI will occur up to 4-weeks prior to surgery. Delirium is followed postoperatively, days 1-4
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the association between preoperative white matter connectivity (DTI) (derived from MRI) and postoperative delirium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative MRI will occur up to 4-weeks prior to surgery. Delirium is followed postoperatively, days 1-4
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the association between preoperative cortical thickness (derived from MRI) and postoperative delirium

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-operative measure: Up to 4 weeks prior to surgery. Post-operative measure: Up to one year after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the impact of delirium and the relationship of preoperative imaging biomarkers with a change in long term cognition

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cognition is assessed preoperatively. Participants are followed for delirium on postoperative days 1-4
secondary_outcome.description: Examine the association between preoperative cognition using a neuropsychological battery, and postoperative delirium incidence.

intervention.description: EEG is a safe non-invasive technology without complications that may be used to help diagnose delirium

biospec_descr.textblock: Participant blood will be collected and stored for future analysis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients, 65 years of age and olderd, undergoing noncardiac surgery with an estimated length of stay of 2 days or greater.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥65 years
- Anticipated length of hospital stay of at least 2 days after noncardiac surgery that occurs under general or neuraxial anesthesia
- Written Informed Consent for potential participation prior to noncardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to MRI or EEG (e.g. implanted devices not safe for MRI studies, claustrophobia, unable to lie flat or still),
- Unable or unwilling to attend the follow-up appointments,
- Documented history of dementia
- Residing in a nursing home,
- Undergoing carotid artery surgery or intracranial surgery
- Unable to complete neurocognitive testing due to language, vision or hearing impairment,
- Unable to communicate with the research staff due to language barriers,
